intro: Heliotropium personatum, commonly known as the purple heliotrope, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central and South America. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender, branched stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from pink to deep purple, often with a faintly fragrant scent. Its leaves are opposite, ovate to lanceolate, and usually covered in a soft, downy texture. Heliotropium personatum is often found in disturbed soils and along coastal areas, thriving in warm, humid climates.
